ground_truth: Annina runs up to him and hugs him. He looks over and sees Rick. At the bar, Carl whispers in Sacha's ear. He kisses Rick on both cheeks. Carl pours a brandy for Rick. Pretending not to do so, Rick glances in Ilsa's direction. Renault comes up to him. He smiles and walks away. Laszlo comes up to Rick. Rick gets up, as does Laszlo. Laszlo looks at him, puzzled. Rick and Laszlo hear male voices singing downstairs. Rick stands at the balcony outside his office and watches the Germans below. At the bar, Renault watches with raised eyebrow. Laszlo's lips are very tight as he listens to the song. He starts down the step. Yvonne, sitting at a table with her German officer, stares down into her drink. Laszlo speaks to the orchestra. Laszlo passes the table where Ilsa sits and goes straight to the orchestra. Members of the orchestra glance toward the steps, toward Rick, who nods to them. Laszlo and Corina sing as they start to play. Strasser conducts the German singing in an attempt to drown out the competition. After a while, Strasser and his officers give up and sit down. Yvonne jumps up and sings with tears in her eyes. Ilsa, overcome with emotion, looks proudly at Laszlo, who sings with passion. Finally the whole cafe stands, singing, their faces aglow. The song finishes on a high, triumphant note. Yvonne's face is exalted. She shouts at the top of her lungs. She deliberately faces the alcove where the Germans are watching. Several French officers surround Laszlo, offering him a drink. Renault thinks a moment, then blows a loud blast on his whistle. The room grows quiet, all eyes turn toward Renault. An angry murmur starts among the crowd. People get up and begin to leave. Rick comes quickly up to Renault. This display of nerve leaves Rick at a loss. The croupier comes out of the gambling room and up to Renault. He hands him a roll of bills. His manner is abrupt but cordial. As the cafe empties, Strasser approaches Ilsa. She looks at him, understanding what he means. He bows and exits as Laszlo arrives at the table. They start out of the cafe. Ilsa and Laszlo walk to their room. Laszlo switches on the light as they enter. While Ilsa takes off some jewelry, he walks to the window and peers out into the darkness. Below and across the street, a man stands under an arch. Laszlo watches him, then draws down the shade. He crosses to a table, takes a cigarette from a box, and strikes a match. He lights the cigarette. Ilsa is now noticeably uncomfortable. Ilsa walks over to the couch and sits down.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Annina jogs up to him and embraces him. He glances over and spots Rick. At the pub, Carl murmurs in Sacha's ear. He pecks Rick on both cheeks. Carl fills a cognac for Rick. Feigning not to do so, Rick peeks in Ilsa's direction. Renault approaches him. He grins and strolls away. Laszlo approaches Rick. Rick rises, as does Laszlo. Laszlo gazes at him, bewildered. Rick and Laszlo overhear male voices vocalizing downstairs. Rick stands at the terrace outside his workplace and observes the Germans below. At the bar, Renault observes with elevated eyebrow. Laszlo's mouth is very taut as he listens to the melody. He begins down the stairs. Yvonne, seated at a table with her German officer, gazes into her beverage. Laszlo addresses the band. Laszlo passes the table where Ilsa sits and goes directly to the band. Members of the band glance toward the stairs, toward Rick, who nods to them. Laszlo and Corina chant as they start to play. Strasser directs the German singing in an effort to drown out the rivalry. After a while, Strasser and his officers concede and sit down. Yvonne springs up and sings with tears in her eyes. Ilsa, overwhelmed with emotion, looks proudly at Laszlo, who sings with fervor. Finally, the entire cafe rises, singing, their faces aglow. The melody concludes on a high, victorious note. Yvonne's face is elated. She hollers at the top of her lungs. She deliberately faces the alcove where the Germans are observing. Several French officers encircle Laszlo, offering him a beverage. Renault considers a moment, then blows a loud blast on his whistle. The room falls silent, all eyes turn toward Renault. An irate murmur begins among the crowd. People rise and commence to leave. Rick comes swiftly up to Renault. This display of courage leaves Rick at a loss. The croupier emerges from the gaming chamber and up to Renault. He hands him a bundle of bills. His demeanor is blunt but friendly. As the cafe clears, Strasser approaches Ilsa. She regards him, understanding what he signifies. He bows and departs as Laszlo arrives at the table. They start out of the cafe. Ilsa and Laszlo stroll to their room. Laszlo switches on the light as they enter. While Ilsa removes some jewelry, he walks to the window and peers out into the darkness. Below and across the street, a man stands under an archway. Laszlo observes him, then draws down the shade. He crosses to a table, takes a cigarette from a box, and strikes a match. He lights the cigarette. Ilsa is now noticeably uneasy. Ilsa walks over to the sofa and sits down.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Annina runs to him and hugs him. He sees Rick. At the bar, Carl whispers to Sacha and kisses Rick on both cheeks, then pours him a brandy. Rick discreetly glances at Ilsa. Renault approaches, smiles, and leaves. Laszlo joins Rick, puzzled. They hear male voices singing downstairs. Rick watches the Germans from his office balcony. Renault observes with a raised eyebrow. Laszlo listens tightly to the song and heads downstairs. Yvonne, with her German officer, stares into her drink. Laszlo speaks to the orchestra, passing Ilsa's table. The orchestra looks to Rick, who nods. Laszlo and Corina sing as the orchestra plays. Strasser tries to drown them out but eventually gives up. Yvonne, tearful, joins in, and Ilsa proudly watches Laszlo sing passionately. The cafe stands, singing triumphantly. Yvonne shouts, facing the Germans. French officers offer Laszlo a drink. Renault blows his whistle, silencing the room. An angry murmur begins as people leave. Rick approaches Renault, surprised. The croupier hands Renault a roll of bills. As the cafe empties, Strasser approaches Ilsa, who understands his meaning. He bows and exits as Laszlo arrives. Ilsa and Laszlo leave for their room. Laszlo turns on the light, and Ilsa removes her jewelry. He peers out the window at a man under an arch, then lowers the shade. He lights a cigarette, and Ilsa sits on the couch, visibly uncomfortable.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Annina hugs him as he sees Rick. At the bar, Carl whispers to Sacha and kisses Rick's cheeks, then pours him a brandy. Rick discreetly glances at Ilsa. Renault approaches, smiles, and leaves. Laszlo joins Rick, puzzled. They hear singing downstairs. Rick watches Germans from his balcony. Renault observes with a raised eyebrow. Laszlo listens tightly, then heads to the orchestra, passing Ilsa. The orchestra looks to Rick, who nods. Laszlo and Corina sing. Strasser tries to drown them out but fails. Yvonne joins, tearfully singing. Ilsa proudly watches Laszlo. The cafe stands, singing triumphantly. Yvonne shouts, facing the Germans. French officers offer Laszlo a drink. Renault blows his whistle, silencing the room. An angry murmur starts, and people leave. Rick approaches Renault, confused. The croupier gives Renault a roll of bills. As the cafe empties, Strasser approaches Ilsa, who understands. He exits as Laszlo arrives. Ilsa and Laszlo leave for their room. Laszlo turns on the light, watches a man outside, then lowers the shade. He lights a cigarette as Ilsa, uncomfortable, sits on the couch.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Annina eagerly runs up to him and wraps her arms around him in a warm embrace. He glances over and notices Rick standing nearby. Meanwhile, at the bar, Carl leans in close and whispers something into Sacha's ear. In a friendly gesture, he kisses Rick on both cheeks. Carl then proceeds to pour a glass of brandy for Rick. While pretending not to be doing so, Rick subtly glances in the direction where Ilsa is seated. Renault approaches him with a smile, then turns and walks away. Laszlo makes his way over to Rick. As Rick rises from his seat, Laszlo does the same. Laszlo looks at Rick with a puzzled expression on his face. Both Rick and Laszlo hear the sound of male voices singing from downstairs. Rick steps out onto the balcony outside his office and observes the Germans below. At the bar, Renault watches the scene unfold with a raised eyebrow. Laszlo's lips are tightly pressed together as he listens intently to the song. He begins to descend the steps. Yvonne, who is sitting at a table with her German officer, gazes down into her drink. Laszlo approaches the orchestra and speaks to them. As he passes the table where Ilsa is seated, he heads directly to the orchestra. The members of the orchestra glance toward the steps and then toward Rick, who gives them a nod of approval. Laszlo and Corina begin to sing as the orchestra starts to play. Strasser attempts to conduct the German singing in an effort to drown out the competition. After some time, Strasser and his officers concede and sit down. Yvonne suddenly jumps up and joins in the singing, tears welling in her eyes. Overcome with emotion, Ilsa looks at Laszlo with pride as he sings passionately. Eventually, the entire cafe stands together, singing with their faces glowing with emotion. The song concludes on a high, triumphant note. Yvonne's face is filled with exaltation as she shouts at the top of her lungs. She deliberately turns to face the alcove where the Germans are watching. Several French officers gather around Laszlo, offering him a drink in celebration. Renault pauses to think for a moment, then blows a loud, piercing blast on his whistle. The room falls silent, and all eyes turn toward Renault. An angry murmur begins to ripple through the crowd. People start to rise from their seats and begin to leave. Rick quickly approaches Renault, feeling at a loss due to this bold display of nerve. The croupier emerges from the gambling room and approaches Renault, handing him a roll of bills. His manner is abrupt yet cordial. As the cafe gradually empties, Strasser approaches Ilsa. She looks at him, fully understanding the implication of his presence. He bows politely and exits just as Laszlo arrives at the table. Together, they start to leave the cafe. Ilsa and Laszlo walk back to their room. As they enter, Laszlo switches on the light. While Ilsa removes some of her jewelry, he walks over to the window and peers out into the darkness. Below and across the street, a man stands under an archway. Laszlo watches him for a moment, then lowers the shade. He crosses over to a table, takes a cigarette from a box, and strikes a match to light it. Ilsa, now noticeably uncomfortable, walks over to the couch and sits down.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With an aura of eagerness, Annina rushes up to him, wrapping her arms around him in a heartfelt, warm embrace. His gaze shifts, and he becomes aware of Rick standing just nearby. Meanwhile, over at the bustling bar area, Carl leans in closely and whispers something discreetly into Sacha's ear. In a display of friendliness, he affectionately kisses Rick on both cheeks. Following this gesture, Carl goes on to pour a glass of brandy and offers it to Rick. All the while, under the guise of indifference, Rick subtly directs his gaze toward the area where Ilsa is seated. Renault approaches with a broad smile, only to turn and walk away promptly. Laszlo then approaches Rick with a sense of purpose. As Rick stands up from his seat, Laszlo mirrors his movements, rising as well. With a puzzled look etched across his face, Laszlo glances at Rick. Simultaneously, both Rick and Laszlo catch the sound of male voices resonating from the floor below, singing harmoniously. Rick steps out and positions himself on the balcony just outside his office, observing the German crowd gathered below. Back at the bar, Renault watches the unfolding scene with a raised eyebrow, taking in the situation. Laszlo's lips are tightly pressed together, a sign of his deep concentration as he listens intently to the rousing song. He makes his way down the steps methodically. Yvonne, seated at a table with a German officer, gazes contemplatively into her drink. Laszlo approaches the orchestra purposefully and speaks to them. As he strides past the table where Ilsa is seated, he heads directly toward the orchestra. The orchestra members, sensing Laszlo's presence, glance toward the steps and then toward Rick, who gives them a nod of approval, encouraging them. Laszlo and Corina begin to sing fervently as the orchestra starts playing in accompaniment. In an effort to counteract, Strasser attempts to conduct the German singing, trying to overwhelm the competition with volume. After some time and effort, Strasser and his officers, realizing their defeat, concede and sit down. Suddenly, Yvonne jumps up energetically and joins in the singing, her eyes brimming with tears. Overcome with emotion, Ilsa gazes at Laszlo, filled with immense pride as he sings passionately with all his heart. Eventually, the entire cafe unites, standing together, their faces glowing with emotion as they sing in unison. The song concludes on a high, triumphant note, filling the room with a sense of exaltation. Yvonne's face is lit up with exhilaration as she shouts at the top of her lungs. She deliberately turns to face the alcove where the observing Germans are seated. A group of French officers gather around Laszlo, offering him a drink in celebration of the momentous occasion. Renault pauses, pondering momentarily, then blows a loud, piercing blast on his whistle, demanding attention. Instantly, the room falls silent, with all eyes turning toward Renault. An angry murmur begins to ripple through the crowd, growing in intensity. People gradually start to rise from their seats, preparing to leave. Rick hastily approaches Renault, his mind reeling due to this bold display of nerve. The croupier makes his appearance from the shadows of the gambling room and approaches Renault, handing over a roll of bills with an abrupt yet cordial manner. As the cafe gradually empties, Strasser approaches Ilsa, and she looks at him, fully aware of the implication of his presence there. He bows politely, acknowledging her, and exits, just as Laszlo arrives at the table. Together, Ilsa and Laszlo start to leave the cafe, their footsteps echoing softly. Ilsa and Laszlo walk companionably back to their room. As they enter, Laszlo switches on the light, illuminating the room. While Ilsa methodically removes some of her jewelry, he strolls over to the window and peers out into the enveloping darkness. Below, across the street, a man stands silently under an archway. Laszlo observes him for a contemplative moment before lowering the shade. He then crosses over to a table, retrieves a cigarette from a box, and strikes a match to light it. Meanwhile, Ilsa, now noticeably uneasy, walks over to the couch and sits down, lost in thought.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Annina, filled with excitement, runs up to him with open arms and embraces him warmly. As he returns the hug, he glances over and notices Rick standing nearby. Meanwhile, at the bar, Carl leans in close to Sacha and whispers something softly into his ear. In a friendly gesture, Carl approaches Rick and greets him by kissing him on both cheeks. He then turns to the bar and carefully pours a glass of brandy for Rick, who, while trying to appear nonchalant, subtly shifts his gaze in Ilsa's direction. Renault approaches Rick with a smile, and after a brief exchange, he turns and walks away. Laszlo then approaches Rick, prompting Rick to rise from his seat, with Laszlo following suit. Laszlo looks at Rick with a puzzled expression, trying to understand the situation. As they stand there, they hear the sound of male voices singing from downstairs. Rick steps out onto the balcony outside his office, where he stands and observes the Germans singing below. At the bar, Renault watches the scene unfold with a raised eyebrow, intrigued by the unfolding events. Laszlo listens intently to the song, his lips pressed tightly together in concentration. Determined, he begins to descend the steps. Yvonne, seated at a table with her German officer companion, gazes down into her drink, lost in thought. Laszlo approaches the orchestra and speaks to them, passing by the table where Ilsa sits without stopping, heading directly to the musicians. The members of the orchestra glance toward the steps and then toward Rick, who gives them a nod of approval. With that signal, Laszlo and Corina begin to sing as the orchestra starts to play. Strasser, in an attempt to overpower their performance, conducts the German singing, but after a while, he and his officers concede defeat and sit down. Yvonne, overcome with emotion, jumps up and joins in the singing, tears glistening in her eyes. Ilsa, moved by the moment, looks at Laszlo with pride as he sings passionately. The entire cafe, caught up in the fervor, stands and sings along, their faces illuminated with a sense of triumph. The song reaches its conclusion on a high, victorious note, leaving Yvonne's face radiant with exaltation. She shouts with all her might, deliberately turning to face the alcove where the Germans are watching. Several French officers gather around Laszlo, offering him a drink in celebration. Renault, after a moment of contemplation, blows a loud blast on his whistle, causing the room to fall silent as all eyes turn toward him. An angry murmur begins to ripple through the crowd as people rise from their seats and start to leave. Rick quickly approaches Renault, feeling at a loss for words in the face of such boldness. The croupier emerges from the gambling room and approaches Renault, handing him a roll of bills with an abrupt yet cordial manner. As the cafe empties, Strasser makes his way to Ilsa, who meets his gaze with an understanding of his intentions. He bows politely and exits just as Laszlo arrives at the table. Together, Ilsa and Laszlo make their way out of the cafe and walk to their room. Upon entering, Laszlo switches on the light, illuminating the space. While Ilsa removes some of her jewelry, Laszlo walks over to the window and peers out into the darkness. Below, across the street, he notices a man standing under an arch, watching intently. Laszlo observes the man for a moment before drawing down the shade to block the view. He then crosses to a table, selects a cigarette from a box, and strikes a match to light it. As he takes a drag, Ilsa, now visibly uncomfortable, walks over to the couch and sits down, contemplating the events that have transpired.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Annina runs up to him and hugs him as he notices Rick nearby. At the bar, Carl whispers to Sacha and then greets Rick with a kiss on both cheeks before pouring him a brandy. Rick discreetly glances at Ilsa while Renault approaches, smiles, and walks away. Laszlo joins Rick, and they both stand, puzzled by the male voices singing downstairs. Rick observes the Germans from his office balcony, while Renault watches from the bar with a raised eyebrow. Laszlo listens intently to the song, his lips tight, and then heads to the orchestra, passing Ilsa's table. The orchestra members look to Rick, who nods, and Laszlo and Corina begin to sing. Strasser attempts to drown them out with German singing but eventually gives up. Yvonne, emotional, joins in with tears in her eyes, and Ilsa looks proudly at Laszlo's passionate singing. The entire cafe stands and sings triumphantly, with Yvonne exalting and facing the Germans defiantly. French officers surround Laszlo, offering drinks, as Renault blows his whistle, quieting the room and prompting an angry murmur. As people begin to leave, Rick approaches Renault, feeling at a loss. The croupier hands Renault a roll of bills, and as the cafe empties, Strasser approaches Ilsa, who understands his meaning before he exits. Laszlo arrives, and they leave the cafe together. In their room, Laszlo switches on the light while Ilsa removes her jewelry. He peers out the window at a man standing under an arch, then lowers the shade, lights a cigarette, and notices Ilsa's discomfort as she sits on the couch.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Annina runs up to him and hugs him, her relief palpable as she reunites with her long-lost love in the bustling Moroccan city of Casablanca, a refuge for those fleeing the war. He looks over and sees Rick, the enigmatic American who owns the famous CafÃ© AmÃ©ricain, a hub for expatriates and wartime intrigue. At the bar, Carl, the kind-hearted waiter who often aids desperate refugees, whispers in Sacha's ear. Sacha, the ever-cunning bartender, kisses Rick on both cheeks, a common greeting in Casablanca signifying camaraderie. Carl pours a brandy for Rick, a luxury drink sourced with difficulty due to wartime rationing. Pretending not to do so, Rick glances in Ilsa's direction, memories of their past romance in Parisâ€”before the German occupationâ€”still fresh. Renault, the opportunistic yet charming French police captain, comes up to him. He smiles slyly and walks away, always playing both sides for survival. Laszlo, a renowned Czech resistance leader wanted by the Nazis, comes up to Rick. Rick gets up, as does Laszlo, both men measuring each other as potential allies or foes. Laszlo looks at him, puzzled by Rick's aloof demeanor. Rick and Laszlo hear male voices singing downstairsâ€”patrons raising their spirits through song in defiance of the oppressors. Rick stands at the balcony outside his officeâ€”a vantage point that allows him to observe the fervor belowâ€”and watches the Germans, who are gathered to exert their influence, below. At the bar, Renault watches with raised eyebrow, always calculating his next move. Laszlo's lips are very tight as he listens to the song, a symbol of resistance against the occupying forces. He starts down the steps, determined to rally the crowd. Yvonne, sitting at a table with her German officer, stares down into her drink, conflicted by her company and her loyalties. Laszlo speaks to the orchestra, encouraging them to play "La Marseillaise," the French national anthem, as an act of defiance. Laszlo passes the table where Ilsa sits and goes straight to the orchestra. Members of the orchestra glance toward the steps, toward Rick, who nods to them, granting permission for this bold act. Laszlo and Corina, an accomplished singer and ally of the Resistance, sing as they start to play. Strasser, a stern German officer intent on stifling dissent, conducts the German singing in an attempt to drown out the competition. After a while, Strasser and his officers give up and sit down, defeated by the spontaneous uprising of patriotism. Yvonne jumps up and sings with tears in her eyes, her allegiance reclaimed. Ilsa, overcome with emotion, looks proudly at Laszlo, who sings with passion and conviction for a free Europe. Finally the whole cafe stands, singing, their faces aglow, unified in their defiance. The song finishes on a high, triumphant note, igniting a spirit of rebellion. Yvonne's face is exalted, transformed by hope. She shouts at the top of her lungs, sending a clear message of defiance. She deliberately faces the alcove where the Germans are watching, challenging their authority. Several French officers surround Laszlo, offering him a drink, a gesture of support and camaraderie. Renault thinks a moment, then blows a loud blast on his whistle, a signal to regain control or perhaps orchestrate an exit strategy. The room grows quiet, all eyes turn toward Renault, aware of the delicate balance he maintains between the occupiers and the occupied. An angry murmur starts among the crowd, charged with the tension of the moment. People get up and begin to leave, aware of the potential repercussions. Rick comes quickly up to Renault, aware that the captain's actions could have dire consequences. This display of nerve leaves Rick at a loss, as he contemplates his own role in this conflict. The croupier comes out of the gambling room and up to Renault, his presence a reminder of the ongoing, perilous environment. He hands him a roll of bills, a bribe or payment for services rendered, his manner is abrupt but cordial, a necessity in these uncertain times. As the cafe empties, Strasser approaches Ilsa, intent on intimidation or persuasion. She looks at him, understanding what he meansâ€”a reminder of the ever-present danger. He bows and exits as Laszlo arrives at the table, their escape still uncertain. They start out of the cafe, knowing the risk that lies ahead. Ilsa and Laszlo walk to their room, a fleeting sanctuary in a city under constant surveillance. Laszlo switches on the light as they enter, illuminating the sparse, temporary quarters they've come to call home. While Ilsa takes off some jewelry, a reminder of a more carefree past, he walks to the window and peers out into the darkness, aware of the ever-present threat. Below and across the street, a man stands under an arch, possibly an ally or informant. Laszlo watches him, then draws down the shade, ensuring their privacy. He crosses to a table, takes a cigarette from a box, a momentary comfort, and strikes a match. He lights the cigarette, its glow brief and calming. Ilsa is now noticeably uncomfortable, the weight of their circumstances pressing down. Ilsa walks over to the couch and sits down, her mind racing with the uncertainties of their future.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Annina runs up to him and hugs him. He looks over and sees Rick. At the bar Carl whispers in Sacha's ear. He kisses Rick on both cheeks. Carl pours a brandy for Rick. Pretending not to do so. Rick glances in Ilsa's direction. Renault comes up to him. He smiles and walks away. Laszlo comes up to Rick. Rick gets up as does Laszlo. Laszlo looks at him puzzled. Rick and Laszlo hear male voices singing downstairs. Rick stands at the balcony outside his office and watches the Germans below. At the bar Renault watches with raised eyebrow. Laszlo's lips are very tight as he listens to the song. He starts down the step. Yvonne sitting at a table with her German officer stares down into her drink. Laszlo speaks to the orchestra. Laszlo passes the table where Ilsa sits and goes straight to the orchestra. Members of the orchestra glance toward the steps toward Rick who nods to them. Laszlo and Corina sing as they start to play. Strasser conducts the German singing in an attempt to drown out the competition. After a while Strasser and his officers give up and sit down. Yvonne jumps up and sings with tears in her eyes. Ilsa overcome with emotion looks proudly at Laszlo who sings with passion. Finally the whole cafe stands singing their faces aglow. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. The song finishes on a high triumphant note. Yvonne's face is exalted. She shouts at the top of her lungs. She deliberately faces the alcove where the Germans are watching. Several French officers surround Laszlo offering him a drink. Renault thinks a moment then blows a loud blast on his whistle. The room grows quiet all eyes turn toward Renault. An angry murmur starts among the crowd. People get up and begin to leave. Rick comes quickly up to Renault. This display of nerve leaves Rick at a loss. The croupier comes out of the gambling room and up to Renault. He hands him a roll of bills. His manner is abrupt but cordial. As the cafe empties Strasser approaches Ilsa. She looks at him understanding what he means. He bows and exits as Laszlo arrives at the table. They start out of the cafe. Ilsa and Laszlo walk to their room. Laszlo switches on the light as they enter. While Ilsa takes off some jewelry he walks to the window and peers out into the darkness. Below and across the street a man stands under an arch. Laszlo watches him then draws down the shade. He crosses to a table takes a cigarette from a box and strikes a match. He lights the cigarette. Ilsa is now noticeably uncomfortable. Ilsa walks over to the couch and sits down.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Annina runs up to him and hugs him. He looks over and sees Rick. At the bar Carl whispers in Sacha's ear. He kisses Rick on both cheeks. Carl pours a brandy for Rick. Pretending not to do so. Rick glances in Ilsa's direction. Renault comes up to him. He smiles and walks away. Laszlo comes up to Rick. Rick gets up as does Laszlo. Laszlo looks at him puzzled. Rick and Laszlo hear male voices singing downstairs. Rick stands at the balcony outside his office and watches the Germans below. At the bar Renault watches with raised eyebrow. Laszlo's lips are very tight as he listens to the song. He starts down the step. Yvonne sitting at a table with her German officer stares down into her drink. Laszlo speaks to the orchestra. Laszlo passes the table where Ilsa sits and goes straight to the orchestra. Members of the orchestra glance toward the steps toward Rick who nods to them. Laszlo and Corina sing as they start to play. Strasser conducts the German singing in an attempt to drown out the competition. After a while Strasser and his officers give up and sit down. Yvonne jumps up and sings with tears in her eyes. Ilsa overcome with emotion looks proudly at Laszlo who sings with passion. Finally the whole cafe stands singing their faces aglow. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Elena skips over to the cat and taps its paw. The cat glances around and notices Ben. In the kitchen, Tom mumbles into Eva's scarf. He pats Ben on both shoulders. Tom fills a teapot for Ben. Acting as if uninterested, Ben peeks toward Mia's position. Grayson strolls near the cat. The cat chuckles and hops away. Jenny strides near Ben. Ben stands, as does Jenny. Jenny gazes at him, perplexed. Ben and Jenny detect female birds chirping outside. Ben leans against the railing beside his porch and observes the ducks flying. In the kitchen, Grayson observes with a twinkling nose. Jenny's eyebrows are furrowed as she absorbs the tune. She marches down the hill. Abigail, lounging on a bench with her Spanish soldier, glances down at her muffin. Jenny whispers to the choir. Jenny bypasses the bench where Mia rests and moves directly to the choir. Members of the choir peek toward the hill, toward Ben, who winks at them. Jenny and Olivia hum as they begin to strum. Oliver guides the parrots squawking in an effort to overcome the harmony. Eventually, Oliver and his sergeants relent and settle down. Abigail leaps up and chirps with laughter in her voice. Mia, overwhelmed with joy, beams fondly at Jenny, who hums with fervor. At last, the entire lounge hums, grinning, their expressions radiant. The melody concludes on a brilliant, victorious beat. Abigail's grin is ecstatic. She whispers with all her might. She intentionally faces the alcove where the parrots are perched. Several Brazilian dancers encircle Jenny, extending to her a muffin. Grayson ponders for a moment, then snaps a loud click with his fingers. The area falls silent, every head turns toward Grayson. A confused buzz begins among the audience. Creatures rise and commence departing. Ben dashes swiftly to Grayson. This show of courage confounds Ben. The pastry chef emerges from the pantry and crosses to Grayson. He presents him a stack of cards. His demeanor is terse yet friendly. As the lounge clears, Oliver advances toward Mia. She acknowledges him, recognizing his intent. He nods and exits as Jenny reaches the bench. They proceed out of the lounge. Mia and Jenny stroll to their den. Jenny flicks on the lamp as they step inside. While Mia removes some earrings, she strides to the balcony and gazes out into the dusk. Below and across the courtyard, a rabbit perches beneath a tree. Jenny observes it, then draws up the curtain. She wanders to a desk, grabs a candy from a jar, and flicks a lighter. She kindles the candy. Mia is now visibly uneasy. Mia strolls over to the hammock and reclines.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Annina embraces him while Rick notices from afar. At the bar, Carl whispers to Sacha, kisses Rick, and pours him brandy. Rick subtly glances at Ilsa before Renault approaches and exits. Laszlo arrives, and both he and Rick stand upon hearing male voices singing below. Rick observes from a balcony, while Renault watches skeptically. Laszlo, tense, walks to the orchestra, passing Ilsa, and encourages them to play. Despite Strasser's attempts to overpower their song, the Germans eventually relent. Yvonne passionately joins in, evoking emotion from Ilsa and pride from Laszlo. The entire cafe sings triumphantly, with Yvonne defiantly facing the Germans. As French officers gather around Laszlo, Renault whistles to silence the room, prompting the crowd to disperse. Rick approaches Renault, perplexed by the situation. As the cafe clears, Strasser confronts Ilsa before exiting. Ilsa and Laszlo head to their room, where Laszlo notices a man outside. Drawing the shade, he lights a cigarette while Ilsa, uncomfortable, sits on the couch.
